Job Title: GIHE Summer Intern

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Working at Real Chemistry and in the healthcare industry isn’t just a job for us. We got into this field for different reasons, but we all stay for the same reason – to uncover insights, make meaningful connections, infuse creativity, and improve the patient experience by transforming healthcare through AI and ideas.

Real Chemistry creates the world around modern therapies with over 2,000 talented professionals, and for the last 20+ years has, carved out its space at the intersection between healthcare, marketing and communications, data & AI, and the people at the heart of it all. We work with the top 30 pharma and biotech companies and are built for uncommon collaboration—we believe we are best together, bring together experts from a wide range of disciplines collaborate without barriers under a single, unified mission: to transform what healthcare is to what it should be. This one-of-a-kind model allows us to work in a way that better reflects how people experience healthcare—all with the intent to transform healthcare from what it is to what it should be. But we can’t do it alone – you in?

We invite current seniors and recent graduates (< 6 months out of school) to apply for our summer internship with our Global Inclusion & Health Equity team. The 10 week internship program runs May 28th through August 2nd. Real Chemistry is looking for driven, savvy game changers who are ready to dive into the trenches and make an immediate impact.

Location:

For the 2024 summer internship, Real Chemistry is open to you being located anywhere in the US for this remote opportunity.

Real Chemistry is currently operating with a flexible, hybrid approach and giving our teams the ability to operate in the way that works best for them – at home, in office or a mix. We trust our people to decide what works best for them, working together with their teams and leaders to support our customers and make the world a healthier place. This policy will continue to be evaluated and may change in the future as we seek to ensure our people stay inspired, engaged, and motivated to do their best work.

Role Summary

The Global Inclusion and Health Equity (GI&HE) team applies data driven, inclusion and health equity solutions that seamlessly connects dots across the Real Chemistry ecosystem to help our clients make the world a healthier place for all – especially historically marginalized populations. Our approach is rooted in intersectional, community-first, trauma-informed health equity guiding principles and DEI best practices that informs how we create culturally responsive initiatives and work to improve health outcomes for all.

As healthcare companies increasingly commit to operationalizing health equity as a business imperative, the Health Equity & Justice Practice team works with clients to provide strategic counsel as well as design and execute health equity and justice-focused initiatives at the corporate, commercial, clinical and community levels. We leverage our ROOTED engagement model, which applies evidence-based best practices to address the root causes which drives inequities. This includes culturally-responsive and respectful storytelling, programmatic initiatives which address social, structural, racial determinants to effectively reach and engage HCPs, patients and communities.

We partner with the Corporate Strategy team to offer Diversity, Equity & Inclusion strategy and execution, which includes our proprietary inclusive leadership workshops, employee engagement, managers toolkit, as well as leveraging affinity groups and DEI as a brand enhancer and growth lever.

Your work will help position our clients as patient-centric leaders who incorporate the patient voice and perspective into every aspect of their work, from health education and literacy to clinical trials, drug development, and the launch of new therapies.

Through research and relationship-building, you will have a direct impact on the health of patients across many different disease states. You will elevate patient voices to promote awareness of significant patient needs and develop innovative solutions to address them.

Role & Responsibilities

Work on GIHE's web and social presence, posts about GIHE work, etc. as well as the ongoing health equity education and awareness for our RC colleaguesFellows will work on a captivating research project on the subject of finding creative ways to introduce STEM to underrepresented students that are in elementary, middle, and high school. This project will focus on how we can diversify the next generation of the workforce within STEM with a focus on health equity across the health ecosystem.Interns will work on creatively building out a Global Inclusion & Health Equity internal website/social media site for our Real Chemistry colleagues. This project will have a major focus on written communication, project management and strategic social media/website creation.Health Equity Research Project: The Research project question would be: “How are universities (particularly HBCU’s) leading within the health equity space.” Interns would do research on this topic and present their key findings to members of the GI+HE team.Attend internal and client calls/meetings, gathering notes and providing recaps to ensure alignment on call outcomes and next stepsCollaborate closely with internal team members and help ensure integration with appropriate experts, based on project scope, and needs

What are we looking for in you?

You have received or are attaining a bachelor’s degree or higherYou have a passion for helping othersYou have a passion for diversity equity & inclusion and advocacyYou have a curiosity about and/or have previous experience in healthcareYou possess great problem-solving skills and can independently own day-to-day activities with supportYou are highly organized, stick to deadlines, have the ability to multi-task and are comfortable working across various workstreams/projectsYou have the ability to create, nurture, and grow professional relationshipsYou are able to effectively operate in a fast-paced, growing and evolving environmentYou have outstanding creative communication and presentations skills; the sky is the limit for how creative you can be.

The salary for this role is $20.00/ hour. 

Real Chemistry is proud to be Great Place to Work® certified; check out what our people shared about our culture and workplace on our Great Places to Work Profile here .

Working with HART: Since the pandemic, we have adapted to how our people told us they want to work. We have offices in cities with many employees and clients – New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Manchester, UK and London, UK – that serve as hubs where and when they need us, and we encourage employees who live less than a 45-minute commute of a Real Chemistry office to go in at least two days per week. Outside of these offices, we have regions, where people work remotely but come together quarterly for collaboration, culture and learning opportunities. We call this our Hybrid and Regional Teams approach. Real Chemistry believes we are best together – and our workplace strategy fosters connection and collaboration in person – but also supports flexibility for our people.

Real Chemistry offers a comprehensive benefit program and perks, including options for medical, dental, and vision plans, a generous 401k match, flexible PTO, and entitlement to a five-week sabbatical program after 5 years of service. Other perks include an annual wellness reimbursement, student loan debt contributions, mental wellness coaching and support, and access to more than 13,000 online classes with LinkedIn Learning. Additional benefits for those just starting or continuing with their family building journey include access to enhanced fertility support, Bright Horizons family support programs, as well as expanded paid leave for new parents including personalized coaching support through Your 4th Trimester ®. Learn more about our great benefits and perks at: https://www.realchemistry.com/

Real Chemistry is an Equal Opportunity employer. We continually strive to build and sustain an inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees feel empowered to leverage all they bring from their personal lived experience and professional expertise, to make our team the best in the industry. We encourage motivated and qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, ethnic or national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Real Chemistry operates. Should you require accommodations throughout the interview process please let your recruiter know.

Experience Level (if available): Internship
